20110128170211.000|20110128170214.000|TR0|They've always been very hesitant to come 
20110128170214.000|20110128170216.000|TR0|out into the streets and put down unrest 
20110128170216.000|20110128170219.000|TR0|because they don't want to be seen as the 
20110128170219.000|20110128170222.000|TR0|Egyptian army killing Egyptians in the 
20110128170222.000|20110128170224.000|TR0|streets.  There are only -- the most 
20110128170224.000|20110128170227.000|TR0|recent time they were out was in 1985, 
20110128170227.000|20110128170230.000|TR0|when they had to put down a riot by the 
20110128170230.000|20110128170232.000|TR0|police, of all institutions.  And in 1977, 
20110128170232.000|20110128170235.000|TR0|when there were bread riots across the

20110128170323.000|20110128170325.000|TR0|WEDEMAN:  Well, of course, it is protected 
20110128170325.000|20110128170328.000|TR0|-- you know, the nominal head of the army 
20110128170328.000|20110128170331.000|TR0|is President Hosni Mubarak.  But it's seen 
20110128170331.000|20110128170333.000|TR0|as an institution in and of itself, not as 
20110128170333.000|20110128170336.000|TR0|an appendage of the president.
20110128170336.000|20110128170339.000|TR0|
20110128170339.000|20110128170341.000|TR0|And, of course, Egyptians remember the 
20110128170341.000|20110128170344.000|TR0|army's involvement in the October, 1973 
20110128170344.000|20110128170347.000|TR0|war, when, at least in the initial phases, 
20110128170347.000|20110128170349.000|TR0|the Egyptian army was able to drive 
20110128170349.000|20110128170352.000|TR0|Israeli forces away from the Suez Canal, 
20110128170352.000|20110128170355.000|TR0|an area that had been occupied by Israel 
20110128170355.000|20110128170357.000|TR0|in the 1967 War.  So President Mubarak has 
20110128170357.000|20110128170400.000|TR0|been very careful to cultivate the 
20110128170400.000|20110128170402.000|TR0|military, to make sure that they are well 
20110128170402.000|20110128170405.000|TR0|paid, they're well equipped, the army 
20110128170405.000|20110128170408.000|TR0|corps is happy with its lot, and that was 
20110128170408.000|20110128170410.000|TR0|part of -- simply, the process is quite 
20110128170410.000|20110128170413.000|TR0|common in Middle Eastern politics of 
20110128170413.000|20110128170416.000|TR0|placating the army, making sure that the 
20110128170416.000|20110128170418.000|TR0|army will not move against you.
20110128170418.000|20110128170421.000|TR0|
20110128170421.000|20110128170424.000|TR0|So, in that sense, they are associated 
20110128170424.000|20110128170426.000|TR0|with the president.  But as I said, 
20110128170426.000|20110128170429.000|TR0|they've always been hesitant to be 
20110128170429.000|20110128170432.000|TR0|involved or forced or compelled to put 
20110128170432.000|20110128170434.000|TR0|down public unrest.  That has always been

20110128171104.000|20110128171107.000|TR0|(JOINED IN PROGRESS)
20110128171107.000|20110128171109.000|TR0|
20110128171109.000|20110128171112.000|TR0|HILLARY CLINTON, SECRETARY OF STATE:  
20110128171112.000|20110128171115.000|TR0|Before discussing the important matters 
20110128171115.000|20110128171117.000|TR0|that were part of our meeting, I would 
20110128171117.000|20110128171120.000|TR0|like to say something about the unfolding 
20110128171120.000|20110128171123.000|TR0|events in Egypt.
20110128171123.000|20110128171125.000|TR0|
20110128171125.000|20110128171128.000|TR0|We continue to monitor the situation very 
20110128171128.000|20110128171131.000|TR0|closely.  We are deeply concerned about 
20110128171131.000|20110128171133.000|TR0|the use of violence by Egyptian police and 
20110128171133.000|20110128171136.000|TR0|security forces against protesters, and we 
20110128171136.000|20110128171139.000|TR0|call on the Egyptian government to do 
20110128171139.000|20110128171141.000|TR0|everything in its power to restrain the 
20110128171141.000|20110128171144.000|TR0|security forces.  At the same time, 
20110128171144.000|20110128171146.000|TR0|protesters should also are refrain from 
20110128171146.000|20110128171149.000|TR0|violence and express themselves peacefully.
20110128171149.000|20110128171152.000|TR0|
20110128171152.000|20110128171154.000|TR0|As we have repeatedly said, we support the 
20110128171154.000|20110128171157.000|TR0|universal human rights of the Egyptian 
20110128171157.000|20110128171200.000|TR0|people, including the right to freedom of 
20110128171200.000|20110128171202.000|TR0|expression, of association, and of 
20110128171202.000|20110128171205.000|TR0|assembly.  We urge the Egyptian 
20110128171205.000|20110128171208.000|TR0|authorities to allow peaceful protests and 
20110128171208.000|20110128171210.000|TR0|to reverse the unprecedented steps it has 
20110128171210.000|20110128171213.000|TR0|taken to cut off communications.  These 
20110128171213.000|20110128171216.000|TR0|protests underscore that there are deep 
20110128171216.000|20110128171218.000|TR0|grievances within Egyptian society, and 
20110128171218.000|20110128171221.000|TR0|the Egyptian government needs to 
20110128171221.000|20110128171224.000|TR0|understand that violence will not make 
20110128171224.000|20110128171226.000|TR0|these grievances go away.
20110128171226.000|20110128171229.000|TR0|
20110128171229.000|20110128171232.000|TR0|As President Obama said yesterday, reform 
20110128171232.000|20110128171234.000|TR0|is absolutely critical to the well-being 
20110128171234.000|20110128171237.000|TR0|of Egypt.  Egypt has long been an 
20110128171237.000|20110128171239.000|TR0|important partner of the United States on

20110128171242.000|20110128171245.000|TR0|we strongly believe that the Egyptian 
20110128171245.000|20110128171247.000|TR0|government needs to engage immediately

20110128171250.000|20110128171253.000|TR0|needed economic, political and social

20110128172342.000|20110128172345.000|TR0|to play out, which is one reason why I

20110128172348.000|20110128172350.000|TR0|Mubarak to address the Egyptian people to

20110128173549.000|20110128173551.000|TR0|about.  So, that fundamental question is 
20110128173551.000|20110128173554.000|TR0|was what will determine the outcome in 
20110128173554.000|20110128173557.000|TR0|Egyptian, and it will be the Egyptians 
20110128173557.000|20110128173559.000|TR0|that make that decision - Egyptian 
20110128173559.000|20110128173602.000|TR0|security forces.
20110128173602.000|20110128173605.000|TR0|
20110128173605.000|20110128173607.000|TR0|Now, interestingly, President Mubarak 
20110128173607.000|20110128173610.000|TR0|comes from the Egyptian military.  His 
20110128173610.000|20110128173613.000|TR0|support comes from the military.  That is
